Line 28: Line 28:
She stayed in Mamma Mia! for two years before making her first appearance at the [[Edinburgh Fringe]] Festival in 2007, performing in [[C venues|C Theatre]]'s productions of ''[[Cinderella]]'', in the title role and the annual ''Shakespeare For Breakfast'', as Juliet's nurse.<ref name="spotlight-lark"/> The latter making a successful transfer to the [[Canal Cafe Theatre]] in [[Maida Vale#Little Venice|Little Venice]], London.{{Citation needed|date=September 2008}}
She stayed in Mamma Mia! for two years before making her first appearance at the [[Edinburgh Fringe]] Festival in 2007, performing in [[C venues|C Theatre]]'s productions of ''[[Cinderella]]'', in the title role and the annual ''Shakespeare For Breakfast'', as Juliet's nurse.<ref name="spotlight-lark"/> The latter making a successful transfer to the [[Canal Cafe Theatre]] in [[Maida Vale#Little Venice|Little Venice]], London.{{Citation needed|date=September 2008}}
â   â
In 2009 she was asked to take part in the recording of new musical album called '''''Bluebird''''', by [http://www.garethpeterdicks.co.uk Gareth Peter Dicks.] Bluebird is a dramatic WW2 musical, in which she plays the part of English Nurse Roberta Jones. She appeared along with a host of West End stars, including Ramin Karimloo and Stephen Weller. The 24 track album was released in four countries in September 2009, and is available in the UK from [http://www.amazon.co.uk/gp/product/B002PHXA44?ie=UTF8&seller=A220RI62JTF6F8&sn=Escape%20Records Amazon,] Dress Circle and to download here from [http://itunes.apple.com/gb/album/bluebird/id355469829 ITunes]
